metadata.dc:description: We present four cases of tuberculosis of the colon in the form of multiple segmental lesions located in the ascendant, transverse and descendant colon. We comment on the rarity of these locations and how they are easily confused with other diseases, like adenocarcinoma or Crohn's disease. For a correct diagnosis, affectation of the cecum and terminal ileum is useful. In cases in which these zones are not involved, differentiation is very difficult and can only achieved by bacteriological and histological studies after colonoscopy and biopsy.
metadata.dc:title: Localizaciones atípicas de la tuberculosis en el colon.
[Atypical locations of tuberculosis of the colon].
